page.title: 17Farming near Guisborough I
page.content: The 4 farms we looked at are in the N. Moors Nat.Park,to the S.of our area. Highcliffe Farm is at 800 feet(the highest in our area),& has 122 acres. It dates from 1830 & the occupiers have lived there 41 yrs.They have few crops,but 70 cattle & 400 sheep. A govt.subsidy (for land over 600' high) is paid, which the farmer described as 'Reasonable'. Dairy produce is sold at Ruswarp near Whitby or North- allerton; machinery,etc.comes from Dalgetties,Northallerton or Armstrong Richardson,Guisborough. Due to urban dev'ment the farm is now on the town outskirts.The same is true of Hunters Hill Farm to the E. This is 150 acres & has 12 horses & 20 pigs as well as sheep.Pony trekking is a side line. Relations between nearby estate & farm are bad (smell, rubbish disposal. . .)
